text: Can - pours yellowish gold white head - nose and taste of lemon, pine, cracker toast - medium body

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy blond with low white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of pine, citrus, garlic, fruits. Taste is of pine, citrus, slight bitterness. Palate: Medium body, medium carbonation. Overall: Very nice, lovely.

Bottle courtesy of rlgk, at the RLGK tasting, March 2016. Pours a bright, hazy golden body with thin white lacing. Nose is dry fruit and minerals. Soft notes of fresh grass and minerality on the palate. Super drinkable, great stuff.

Pours a hazy golden with a small white head that leaves good lacing. Lots of particles in suspension. Nose is of pine, cereals and some alcohol. Taste is of pine, light floury cereals, fruits and something that feels like granulated white sugar. Moderate body and carbonation. This is not a real kölsch of course, feels more like their IPAs than anything. One of their less successful ones if that was the case, but still. Fun to try but I dont think I would get again.

pours cloudy very light golden with a small creamy white cap offering some retention and lacing. citronella, pale doughy maltiness, some meaty and smooth lagering fruitiness, sweet bread, hint of acidity - candied pineapples, clean yeast. moderate carbonation, light to medium body - oily; semi-sweet citrusy finish. very nice lagerized hop fix.

Bottle from Julios. Pours out a slightly hazy light golden color with a small amount of sediment. Honey-fruity malt aromas and flavors. Fruity white wine notes. Dry bready finish. Update: second glass - bottom of the bottle. HUGE amount of sediment. BIG Deduct on appearance.
damn this is highly drinkable, very clean and crisp malt base, filtered, then BAM hop aroma and flavor explosion. Citrus and floral all over. Ive domed 2 of these 750mls and wish I had more.

Bottle at the jredmond tasting in NYC 160326. Hazy golden beer with a rich off-white head. Bready caramel aroma, passion fruit, pine apples, some peach, biscuit notes. Malty biscuit flavor, pine apples, grapes, oranges, some mango. Bready biscuit finish with peach and pine apples. Fresh kölsch with tropical hops adding to the experience.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of strong floral and fruity hops, some pale malts, and light dough. Flavor the same with a great blend of the Nelson hops and the pale malts/Kolsch. Average texture. A really cool beer.

Overall a great beer! The European hops really shine through and elevate this Kolsch from good to great. Pours a light hazy yellow with an off-white head. Aroma plays to the hops character. Just a really enjoyable brew! If you can find it, try it!

Poured from bottle into a tulip: Pours hazy golden with a decent white head. Aroma dank, light citrus, very tropical. Taste is a little grapey, pale and munich malt, tropical notes, with a solid hop bite at the end. Medium body, soft carbonation, not the style it is listed as. Cheater beer (but tasty).

Bottle shared by William. Pours hazy golden orange with medium sized top and lacing. juicy tropical smell but a little sweet grape forward and overly bitter in the flavor profile. Other notes of grass, cracker and grain. Painfully dry finish. Boat beer at a drinkable 4.2 % puts this to shame.
Cool not a kolsch beer. Hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma is cat piss, white wine grape, papaya, pilsener malt and dank. Taste is dry hoppy and fresh.

Bottle shared. Cloudy gold pour with thin white head. Aroma is quite hoppy, dank, grassy. Taste is grassy, very fruity, juicy hop, lingering bitter finish. Palate is med light bodied with light carbonation. Excellent, but definitely not a kölsch.

Bottle (750 ml). Shared by JulienHuxley, thanks! Split 2-ways. Hazy golden with a medium white head, moderate retention, leaving some lacing. Aroma is of perfumy hops, dank, mild spiciness, a bit of resin, grass and doughy malts. Taste is dank and grassy with doughy malts, mild spiciness, a bit of resin and mild bitterness. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Clean. Crisp. Dank and grassy finish. I dont see how its Kolsch inspired but its a really nice beer nonetheless. The 7.5% abv is really well hidden and this is mightily drinkable. Another awesome hoppy beer by Trillium.

32 oz growler, thank ClarkVV. Bright yellow color without head. Aroma is a Nelson like hop, mild cat pee. Grass notes. 
Flavor is fresh and clean. The Nelson is bold and fresh. The mouthfeel is lively and clean. Really nice.

32oz growler filled 2/19/16, drunk 2/20/16.Copper golden body is lightly hazy. White head atop is lightly retained.Band aid, lemon, cracker, a bit of sulfur. Wow. Not what i was expecting. Kind of bubble gum juicy. Lots of fruitiness. Juju and juicy fruits. No booze.Black pepper and white grapefruit. Super drying and peppery with lots of honey and light leather. Kind of a boatload of hops. Really intense. Very cool. Weird and thoroughly good. Not a kolsch, obviously.

1L howler shared by ClarkVV. Thanks, Clark! Pours orange yellow gold with an off white head. Super juicy grapefruit, tangerine aroma. Flavor follows. Tangerine, grapefruit, dry white wine. Good stuff, but a kolsch?!? Not really.
Poured from growler thanks ClarkVV cloudy lemon pour with a nice white head. Aromas of dank citrus cut grass and nelson hops. Taste follows with nice lingering bitterness.

Thanks Claaaarrrk for sharing this growler. I love Kolsch beers. Cant find them fresh

A - Very hazy, gorgeous orange with a very small head. 

S - The Nelson is strong with this one. So much fantastic aroma with grape skins, apple, pears. mmmmm really smells great.

T - Really good taste. It has this table sugar essence at the finish and I wish it were a lot more dry. The hops used were perfectly picked, the sweetness is not great. Even has a slight bit of coconut.

M - mild carbonation, sweet throughout with a good effervescence

O - Decent beer. would have it again would like just less sugar.

Growler thanks to Phil (2014). Pours a murky orange, big frothy white head. Aroma is stinky pissy nelson, grass, grapefruit, melon, resin. Flavor is very similar, with some earth, lemon grass, faint booze kick. Awesome.
Tap at lord hobo. Potent bright grapefruit. Juicy with some orange sweetness. Bit of bright resin. Bit too bitter. Alsopreferred the lower boost strength sprang gold ale. But drinkable.

Growler thanks to Will. Pours a cloudy gold with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is a strong fresh cut grass and nelson. Medium mouthfeel with strong juicy hop, pine, nelson hop, light dryness. Very nice.

Pours hazy gold into a tulip. White head with medium retention recedes to hug rim. Marshmallow and tropical fruit aromas. Soft and thin with caramel and peach upfront turning to resin in the lasting finish. Tasty, but not a Kolsch.

Pours a murky orange with a rapidly diminishing tan head. Aromas are absolutely delicious waves of mangoes, citrus, and grape. Theres a certain spiciness that seems like it must be from the yeast. The flavor is slightly more subdued, lots of grape candy. The hops are joined by some barely-there bready malts and a hint of alcohol. Smooth and thick body with just enough carbonation.I have a slight preference for (little) Sprang, but this is great!
Pours a hazy orange with a thick white head. The aroma is lemon, tangerine and orange with some pine notes. This is incredibly juicy. Certainly not in the style of a kolsch.
